result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lloyd Heidenreich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay costs in the amount of $243.00 and DNA Analysis
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

Case called at 10:27 am.
State appears by D.A. Gill. 
Atty. Witt appears with Defendant appearing in person and in custody.
Court calls both matters 16CF43 and 18CF89.
Atty. Witt waive formal reading of criminal complaint in CF89.
Defendant wishes to enter plea of Not Guilty.
Set over for Status Jan 23 @930 am. 
State request Defendants appearance be waived if in the custody of the Green County Jail.
Court Orders. 
State gives sentence recommendation in 16CF43 of 9 months in each count, concurrent. 
Atty. Witt gives sentence recommendation of 5 months each count. 
Defendant addresses the Court. 
Court Orders 
Count One-6 Mo Lafayette County Jail.
Count Two-3 Mo Lafayette County Jail, consecutive to count one.
Defendant has 153 days credit. 
Judgement in the amount of $686.00.

Letter from Gregg Waterman, find enclosed Petition and Order Permitting Attorney to Withdraw
permitting attorney to withdraw - Gregg E. Waterman
to Atty Waterman from D.A. Gill

Case called at 2:03 PM.  Defendant Michael Lloyd Heidenreich in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman.  Jenna L Gill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Waterman informs Court resolution reached and files Amended Information with the Court.  Defendant enters plea of Guilty on Count 1 and on Count 2.  Plea Agreement and Plea and Waiver of Rights filed.  Court questions Defendant regarding Plea and Waiver of Rights and his Plea.  Court questions Attorney Waterman regarding plea.  Parties stipulate to a factual basis.  Court is satisfied Defendant enters plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.  State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.  Attorney Waterman concurs with the state's request and makes statement on behalf of the Defendant.  Attorney Waterman is requesting firearms be returned to Defendant from Green County.  Court reviews Green County file and does grant the request of Attorney Waterman to have firearms released from Green County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.  Court accepts plea and is satisfied that resolution is reasonable.
Final status/scheduling conference on January 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:00 AM.
Defendant Michael Lloyd Heidenreich in court, in custody. Attorney Jane Bucher appears for intake purposes.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint.

Court finds probable cause for filing.

The court grants the state's request $300.00 and $1,700.00 signature.
